DataElement.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis C Antibody Test Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, for hepatitis C, an RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer_(AN-tih-BOD-ee) A type of protein made by certain white blood cells in response to a foreign substance (antigen)._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis C Antibody Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, for hepatitis C, an RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer_(AN-tih-BOD-ee) A type of protein made by certain white blood cells in response to a foreign substance (antigen).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: An RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer:(AN-tih-BOD-ee) A type of protein made by certain white blood cells in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody can bind to only a specific antigen. The purpose of this binding is to help destroy the antigen. Antibodies can work in several ways, depending on the nature of the antigen. Some antibodies destroy antigens directly. Others make it easier for white blood cells to destroy the antigen.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.

A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.
